description: Erection of a detached house with one side roof dormer and associated fencing, landscaping, cycle and bin storage. Amendments to the existing house comprising alterations to the fenestration and demolition of the entrance porch.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (9333/001 Rev H, 9333/002 Rev H, 9333/003 Rev H, 9333/004 Rev H, 9333/005 Rev H, 9333/006 Rev H, 9333/007 Rev H, 9333/008 Rev H, 9333/009 Rev H, 9333/010 Rev H, Energy Strategy Report and Fire Risk Assessment, Heritage Statement. Received on 22/11/2022; Design and Access Statement. Received on 01/02/2023; 9333/011 Rev H, 9333/016 Rev K, 9333/017 Rev J, 9333/018 Rev K, 9333/019 Rev K, 9333/020 Rev K, 9333/022 Rev K, 9333/023 Rev J, 9333/024 Rev K and 9333/026 Rev K. Received on 07/02/2023; 9333/114 Rev H, Attenuation Tank Specification, Drainage Plan, Greenfield Runoff Rate Estimates and Surface Water Storage Calculations. Received on 12/07/2023; 9333/116 Rev H. Received on 24/10/2023; Sustainability and Drainage Assessment. Received on 03/11/2023; 9333/ 012 Rev J, 9333/ 013 Rev J, 9333/ 014 Rev J and 9333/ 015 Rev H. Received on 12/01/2024) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The development shall not be implemented other than in accordance with the materials approved under 00975/4/P2(3,11,12,14).

Condition : 4 - The ground floor toilet window formed in the side elevation as shown on drawing numbers 9333/ 012 Rev J & 9333/ 013 Rev J, the first floor bathroom and hallway windows in the side elevation as shown on drawing numbers 9333/ 014 Rev J, 9333/ 015 Rev H & 9333/023 Rev J, the second floor bathroom window formed in the front elevation and dormer window in the side elevation as shown on drawing numbers 9333/016 Rev K,  9333/017 Rev J, 9333/018 Rev K, 9333/019 Rev K, 9333/020 Rev K, 9333/022 Rev K, 9333/023 Rev J, 9333/024 Rev K & 9333/026 Rev K of the hereby approved development shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order) no enlargement of the hereby approved development or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out.

Condition : 6 - a)	No development above ground shall take place until the applicant has entered into a binding arrangement with the Council to make an agreed contribution to the Council's Carbon Offset Fund, in accordance with the zero carbon strategy set out in the Energy Strategy Report hereby approved to an amount that equates to the shortfall in required energy savings to meet the 'zero carbon' target.

b)	Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and any subsequent approved revisions.
Condition : 7 - Prior to first occupation of the building hereby approved, the development shall have been constructed to achieve an internal water use of 105 litres/person/day or less.

Condition : 8 - The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following:

(i)	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.

(ii)	At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.

(iii)	No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 9 - he development hereby approved shall not be occupied until, the boundary treatment and division of the plot as shown on the drawings numbered 9333/ 011 Rev H, 9333/012 Rev J, 9333/013 Rev J, 9333/014 Rev J, 9333/015 Rev H, 9333/116 Rev H, 9333/017 Rev H, 9333/019 Rev J and 9333/020 Rev J have been erected and this boundary shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Condition : 10 - The development hereby approved, shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the hard and soft landscaping details approved under 00975/4/P2(3,11,12,14) and shall be maintained as such at all times thereafter.

Any trees or plants that, within 5 years of planting, die, are cut down, uprooted, destroyed or become (in the opinion of the Local Planning Authority) seriously damaged or defective, shall be replaced with another tree or plant of the same size and species within the first planting season following its death, removal, uprooting or destruction, unless the Local Planning Authority gives its prior written approval to any variation.

Condition : 11 - Either side of the vehicle access hereby approved, visibility splay areas (the depth measured from the back of the footway and the widths outwards from the edges of the access, with a splay of at least 2.4 metres x 2.4 metres) shall be provided before the access and parking area is brought into use. No fence, wall or other obstruction to visibility exceeding 0.6m in height above the surface of the adjoining highway shall be erected on land within the developer's ownership. A clear pedestrian access route, at least 1.2m wide shall be made available and shall thereafter be retained as such, without obstruction, for the lifetime of the development.

Condition : 12 - Secure covered cycle parking facilities (for not less than 2 bicycles) for occupants of the development shall be installed in the cycle shelter. The approved facilities shall conform to the current Westtrans West London Cycle Parking Guidance (or such other guidance as shall supersede it) in design and layout and be fully implemented and made available for use before the first occupation of the development or commencement of the approved use as appropriate and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 13 - The approved refuse and recycling store as shown on the approved drawing numbered 9333/011 Rev H shall be completed and made available for use before the building hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, and thereafter shall be retained for such use at all times without obstruction. Bins shall be stored within the store at all times and shall not be left on the public highway.

Condition : 14 - No demolition or development shall take place until a stage 1 written scheme of investigation (WSI) has been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing. For land that is included within the WSI, no demolition or development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed WSI, including the agreed programme and methodology of site evaluation and the competent person(s) or organisation nominated to undertake the agreed works.

If heritage assets of archaeological interest are identified by stage 1, then for those parts of the site which have archaeological interest a stage 2 WSI shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing. For land that is included within the stage 2 WSI, no demolition/development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed stage 2 WSI, which shall include:


(a)	The statement of significance and research objectives, the programme and methodology of site investigation and recording and the nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the agreed works;

(b)	Where appropriate, details of a programme for delivering related positive public benefits.

(c)	The programme for post-investigation assessment and subsequent analysis, publication & dissemination and deposition of resulting material. This part of the condition shall not be discharged until these elements have been fulfilled in accordance with the programme set out in the stage 2 WSI.

Condition : 15 - Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations and demolition), the applicant must submit a final detailed drainage design drawings, including infiltration testing, supporting calculations and an updated Drainage Assessment Form to the Lead Local Flood Authority for review and approval. A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components must also be submitted to demonstrate how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development. The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the approved details.

Condition : 16 - No part of the development hereby permitted shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and installation contracts) is submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.
